assignment

Class NewProjectMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • assignment.NewProjectMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class NewProjectMenu
extends javax.swing.JPanel

    Sets up a JPanel to be called by the 'New Project' MenuItem in SuiteDirector.

    It contains two combo boxes. One for 'Size' and one for 'Colour'.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    James Euesden - jee22@aber.ac.uk
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • NewProjectMenu

        NewProjectMenu()

        Sets up all of the attributes and components of the menu, ready to be called.

        The constructor makes a new JPanel to hold all of the components and sets it's Layout. Using JLabels, the user can be informed of what each option does.

        The options for user choices are held in JComboBoxs. The selections presented to the user for their choice of starting background colour are displayed as the actual colour.
        This works by using my CustomComboRenderer.

        The panel(newProjectPanel is added to this class in order for it to be used as a JPanel in JOptionPane.
